Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Welcome to the wonderful world of Pages!

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: I'm assuming you've never played before since I just made it.

QuestionText: Would you like to go over the tutorial?

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: This is a Multi Turn-Based game. Each round you and your opponents will plan out multiple turns worth of actions.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Once everyone has thier turns ready, the round will start and all characters will act out thier planned turns.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines:
At the bottom of the screen are your
Pages and PageQue.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: These are your Pages.
Each one is an action you can preform during combat.
Moving,
attacking,
using items,
all of it is done using Pages.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: This is your PageQue.
@WaitForNextButton
It holds the Pages you have queued up for the next round.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: During combat, the game will cycle through Rounds and Turns.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: A Turn is the a single slot on your PageQue.
When your turn comes up, you will act out the Page that was queued in that slot.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: A Round is the full length your PageQue.
Before each round, you will prepare your PageQue by filing each slot with a page.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: When the round starts, characters will begin acting out their turns.
@WaitForNextButton
Each turn, the character will preform the next Page prepared in it's PageQue.
@WaitForNextButton
All characters take thier turns simultaneously, but start the turn ordered by thier Speed.
@WaitForNextButton
Once all PageQues are finished, the round ends and characters start preparing thier PageQue for the next round.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: To keep things simple, let's cut down to just the movement pages.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Let's start by walking towards the cabin to the north east.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: To plan out movement for the round, add Pages to the PageQue by clicking on them.
Or remove them by click thier icon in the PageQue.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Try walking forward one spot,
turn right,
then forward three more times.
[color=black]Queue Pages: [/color]
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/TurnRight.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Whoops, that's not right.
Let's try again.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Notice the big blue arrow that appeared when you added a page?
That shows you where your character will end up when the round is done.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Your PageQue is now ready, so we'll start the round.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: It's important to note that all movement is realive to where your character is facing.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Moving Forward will always be the tile in front of your character.
When facing North:
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/TurnRight.png
goes to the East.
When facing East:
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/TurnRight.png
goes to the South.
And so on.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Now that you've learned to walk, it's time to kill.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Oh look, a conveniantly placed mushroom.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: How about we use that as a target?

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Just like movement, attacks are done using Pages.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: I'll add the Basic Weapon Page back to your PageBook.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: With this Page, you can use you primary weapon to attack a target.
Since you're using a sword, we'll need to get in range.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Walk up right next to the mushroom and attack it twice.
[color=black]Queue Pages: [/color]
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://data/Actions/Movement/MoveForward.png
@Image|res://defs/Items/Equipment/TestWeapons/TestSword.png
@Image|res://defs/Items/Equipment/TestWeapons/TestSword.png

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Whoops, that's not right.
Let's try again.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: See that red area that showed up around your character?
That's a preview for the Target Area of your Basic Weapon Page.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Many Pages will require a target to be selected, but you don't have to pick a target until that Page comes up on your turn.
@WaitForNextButton
When a Page needs a target, the round will pause and you will be asked to select a spot or creature from the Target Area.
@WaitForNextButton
The Target Area shows up as red tiles with circles on valid targets. The area's size and shape depends on the Page, but is always centered on your character.
@WaitForNextButton
If no target is in the area, the Page will fail and your turn will be skipped.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Auto-Targeting is turned on right now. So if only one target is in range, that target is automatically selected.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Without further ado, let's kill this shroom.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: Good job! Now that mushroom will think twice before growing in a tutorial.

Speaker: Narrator
Lines: This is it for the tutorial. But you can stay and play around on the map if you want.
There are more mushrooms and target dummies to the north if you want to play with them.
And I've taken the liberty of adding some fun pages to your Page Book.
